They are stationed in the Kharidian Desert at the Shantay Pass, Uzer, the Bedabin Camp, north and south Pollnivneach, Nardah, and Sophanem. Southern Pollnivneach and Shantay Pass have several travel options acting as hubs of transportation.

Rug Merchants operate magic carpets for Ali Morrisane's flying carpet fleet. There is usually a monkey around these men. They are stationed in the Kharidian Desert at the Shantay Pass, Uzer, the Bedabin Camp, north and south Pollnivneach, Nardah, and Sophanem. Southern Pollnivneach and Shantay Pass have several travel options acting as hubs of transportation.

Using magic carpets requires paying 200 coins. Completing the Rogue Trader miniquest (blackjack or clothes options) or wearing a ring of charos (a) reduces the price to 100 coins. Doing both lowers the cost to 75 coins. Completion of the hard Desert Diary makes all magic carpet rides free.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
17 January 2019
(update)

A missing animation for initial chat dialogue was added.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

Rug merchants no longer charge to use magic carpets if you have completed the hard Desert Diary.

4 January 2007
(update)

The "Travel" option was added, allowing the player to fast travel.

'''Rug Merchants''' operate [[magic carpet]]s for [[Ali Morrisane]]'s flying carpet fleet. There is usually a [[monkey (magic carpet)|monkey]] around these men. They are stationed in the [[Kharidian Desert]] at the [[Shantay Pass]], [[Uzer]], the [[Bedabin Camp]], north and south [[Pollnivneach]], [[Nardah]], and [[Sophanem]]. Southern [[Pollnivneach]] and [[Shantay Pass]] have several travel options acting as hubs of [[transportation]].

Using magic carpets requires paying {{NoCoins|200}} coins. Completing the [[Rogue Trader]] [[miniquest]] ([[blackjack]] or clothes options) or wearing a [[ring of charos (a)]] reduces the price to {{NoCoins|100}} coins. Doing both lowers the cost to {{NoCoins|75}} coins. Completion of the [[hard Desert Diary]] makes all magic carpet rides free.
